Key Match Events: Brandon Ingram scored 33 points and CJ McCollum added 23 as the host New Orleans Pelicans defeated the Chicago Bulls 123-111 in the NBA season opener.
Dejounte Murray had 14 points, 10 assists and eight rebounds.
Jordan Hawkins scored 13 points and rookie first-round draft choice Yves Missi chipped in 12.
Zach LaVine scored 27 points, Nikola Vucevic tallied 21 points and 11 rebounds.
Chicago’s Lonzo Ball played in a regular-season game for the first time since Jan. 14, 2022, after recovering from a knee injury.
McCollum scored five points and Ingram had four during a 9-0 run that enabled New Orleans to open a 76-66 lead midway through the third quarter.
Chicago got back within three points, but the Pelicans’ 8-0 burst pushed the lead to 11, and Murray’s layup gave the Pelicans a 95-83 edge at the end of the third quarter.
The Bulls scored the first seven points of the fourth quarter, but Ingram made 3-pointers to start and complete a 12-2 run that gave New Orleans a 15-point lead midway through the period.
The first quarter featured eight lead changes and three ties, the last of which was broken when Hawkins made a 3-pointer.
McCollum’s 3-pointer capped a 9-1 run that left the Pelicans with a 59-58 halftime edge.
